title: Traveling the Silk Road Today
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Traveling the Silk Road Today.

hook.text: You can still walk parts of the ancient Silk Road. Thousands of travelers do it every year.

buildup.text: The route passes through Uzbekistan, Kyrgyzstan, and western China, following ancient caravan paths.

twist.text: A train now runs from China to London in 18 days, roughly following the old Silk Road.

climax.text: Tourism is reviving forgotten cities. Samarkand's visitor numbers have tripled since 2015.

punchline.text: The ancient road is finding new travelers.
